articles.author: Mariya Gordeyeva
articles.description: An Embraer passenger plane flying from Azerbaijan to Russia crashed near the city of Aktau in Kazakhstan on Wednesday with 62 passengers and five crew on board, Kazakh authorities announced, saying that 27 people had survived.
articles.title: Passenger plane flying from Azerbaijan to Russia crashes in Kazakhstan with many feared dead

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's energy system and cities in its eastern region with cruise and ballistic missiles on Wednesday morning, Ukraine's energy minister and local officials said.
articles.title: Russia attacks Ukraine energy system in major missile strike, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 10 people were killed and more than a dozen wounded in Israeli strikes on Gaza early on Thursday, medics with the Gaza health authorities said.
articles.title: At least 10 killed in Israeli strikes on Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry warned of "serious impact" to security after opposition parties passed laws that will require a cut in defence spending of some T$80 billion ($2.45 billion) at a time when the island is facing elevated Chinese military threat.
articles.title: Taiwan defence ministry warns of 'serious impact' to security under new funding laws

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: Ex-Defence Minister Kim Yong-hyun is likely to be the first to face indictment on the accusation of being a central figure in President Yoon's surprise martial law declaration on Dec. 3.
articles.title: South Korea ex-minister's lawyers defend martial law as Yoon faces impeachment trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The outgoing and incoming U.S. presidents had different messages for the Christmas holiday, with Democrat Joe Biden urging Americans to reflect and unite and Republican Donald Trump offering a holiday greeting and a flurry of politically focused social media posts.
articles.title: Biden, Trump send different Christmas messages

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 200,000 homes across Bosnia and Herzegovina were without electricity for a second day on Wednesday, authorities said, after a snowstorm the day before caused widespread disruption across several Balkan countries.
articles.title: More than 200,000 homes without power in Bosnia after Balkan snowstorm

articles.author: Jasper Ward
articles.description: A dead body was found in the wheel well of a United Airlines jetliner after the aircraft landed in the Hawaiian island of Maui, the airline said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Dead body found in wheel well after United flight lands in Hawaii

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas said on Wednesday Israel has set new conditions that have led to delays in reaching a Gaza ceasefire agreement.
articles.title: Hamas says Israel's new conditions have delayed ceasefire agreement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan Airlines (JAL) said on Thursday it was hit by a cyberattack that caused delays to some domestic and international flights.
articles.title: Japan Airlines hit by cyberattack, causing some delays to its flights
